com.here.sdk.mapview

Class MapPolyline

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.NativeBase
      • com.here.sdk.mapview.MapPolyline

  • public final class MapPolyline
extends NativeBase

    A visual representation of a line on the map. The geometry to be visualized is represented by an instance of GeoPolyline.

    To display the map polyline, it needs to be added to the scene using MapScene.addMapPolyline(com.here.sdk.mapview.MapPolyline). To stop displaying it, remove it from the scene using MapScene.removeMapPolyline(com.here.sdk.mapview.MapPolyline).

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapPolyline

        public MapPolyline(@NonNull
                   GeoPolyline geometry,
                   double widthInPixels,
                   @NonNull
                   Color color)

        Creates a new MapPolyline instance containing the geometry passed in.

        Parameters:
        geometry -

        The list of vertices representing the polyline.

        widthInPixels -

        The width in pixels in which to render the polyline.

        color -

        The color with which to render the polyline. The alpha value of the color is currently ignored and set to 255 (solid).

      • MapPolyline

        public MapPolyline(@NonNull
                   GeoPolyline geometry,
                   double widthInPixels,
                   @NonNull
                   Color color,
                   double outlineWidthInPixels,
                   @NonNull
                   Color outlineColor)

        Creates a new MapPolyline instance with an outline. The width of the outline comes on top of the polyline width, meaning that a line of width 10 and outline width of 2 will have a total width of 14 pixels.

        Parameters:
        geometry -

        The list of vertices representing the polyline.

        widthInPixels -

        The width in pixels in which to render the polyline.

        color -

        The color with which to render the polyline. The alpha value of the color is currently ignored and set to 255 (solid).

        outlineWidthInPixels -

        The width in pixels of the outline on one side of the polyline. The total width of the polyline will thus be width_in_pixels + 2 * outline_width_in_pixels.

        outlineColor -

        The color used to render the outline. The alpha value of the color is currently ignored and set to 255 (solid).

      • setLineCap

        public void setLineCap(@NonNull
                       LineCap value)

        Sets the line caps style.

        Parameters:
        value -

        The line caps (line ending) style of this polyline. The default is {LineCap.ROUND}. The style is applied to both ends of the polyline including the outline.

public Color getLineColor()

        Gets the color of the line.

      • setLineColor

        public void setLineColor(@NonNull
                         Color value)

        Sets the color of the line. Transparency (alpha channel) is not supported and is always set to 255, regardless of the input value.

        Parameters:
        value -

        Color of the line. Transparency (alpha channel) is not supported and is always set to 255, regardless of the input value.

      • getLineWidth

        public double getLineWidth()

        Gets the width of the line in pixels.

      • setLineWidth

        public void setLineWidth(double value)

        Sets the width of the line in pixels. Trying to set to a value of 0 or less has no effect.

        Parameters:
        value -

        Width of the line in pixels. Always a positive value, trying to set to a value of 0 or less has no effect.

      • getOutlineWidth

        public double getOutlineWidth()

        Gets the width the outline in pixels. 0 if there is no outline.

      • setOutlineWidth

        public void setOutlineWidth(double value)

        Sets the width the outline in pixels. 0 to remove the outline. Trying to set negative value has no effect.

        Parameters:
        value -

        Width of the outline in pixels. 0 if there is no outline. Trying to set negative value has no effect.

      • getDashPattern

        @Nullable
public DashPattern getDashPattern()

        Gets currently used dash pattern for this line. Returns null if no pattern is specified.

      • setDashPattern

        public void setDashPattern(@Nullable
                           DashPattern value)

        Sets dash pattern to be used for this line. Pass null to remove the dash pattern.

        Parameters:
        value -

        Specifies dash pattern for this line or null if no pattern is specified. Defaults to null.

      • getDashFillColor

        @Nullable
public Color getDashFillColor()

        Gets currently used color of the filling between dashes of a dashed line or null if the gaps are to be fully transparent.

      • setDashFillColor

        public void setDashFillColor(@Nullable
                             Color value)

        Sets color of the filling between dashes of a dashed line. Pass null to make the gaps fully transparent. Transparency (alpha channel) is not supported and is always set to 255 regardless of the input value.

        Parameters:
        value -

        Specifies color of the filling between dashes of a dashed line or null if the gaps are to be fully transparent. Defaults to null. Transparency (alpha channel) is not supported and is always set to 255 regardless of the input value.

      • getDrawOrder

        public int getDrawOrder()

        Gets MapPolyline draw order. Default value is 0.

      • setDrawOrder

        public void setDrawOrder(int value)

        Sets MapPolyline draw order. Polylines with higher draw order value are drawn on top of polylines with lower draw order. In case multiple polylines have the same draw order value then the order in which they were added to the scene matters. Last added polyline is drawn on top. Allowed range is 0-1023. Values outside this range will be clamped.

        Parameters:
        value -

        MapPolyline draw order. Polylines with higher draw order value are drawn on top of polylines with lower draw order. In case multiple polylines have the same draw order value then the order in which they were added to the scene matters. Last added polyline is drawn on top. Allowed range is 0-1023. Values outside this range will be clamped. Default value is 0.
